http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv-community.gif http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif FOREST-HUMANITIES List FOREST-HUMANITIES List Archives https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?RSS&L=FOREST-HUMANITIES&v=ATOM1.0
This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=FOREST-HUMANITIES.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-05T15:53:28Z Rupert Hildyard 2015-03-05T15:52:56+00:00 2015-03-05T15:52:56+00:00 Re: R.I.P. Oliver Rackham https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FOREST-HUMANITIES;3a8405a3.1503 Dear forest humans, ,<br>Amy is right \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Oliver Rackham is hugely important in all sorts of ways. I am planning an interdisciplinary symposium or one day conference on Rackham\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds work at Lincoln. Would anyone else be interested in organizing this with me?<br>Rupert Hildyard<br><br>Dr Rupert Hildyard<br>Principal Lecturer in English<br>College of Arts<br>University of Lincoln<br>Brayford Pool<br>Lincoln<br>LN6 7TS [...] Amy Cutler 2015-02-17T12:03:25+00:00 2015-02-17T12:03:25+00:00 R.I.P. Oliver Rackham https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FOREST-HUMANITIES;43d3bbc5.1502 Dear all,<br><br>You may perhaps not be aware of the recent sad news of Oliver Rackham's<br>death, which I heard about over the weekend:<br><br>http://www.corpus.cam.ac.uk/news/professor-oliver-rackham-1939-2015/?utm_source=dlvr.it&utm_medium=twitter<br><https://outlook-legacy.leeds.ac.uk/owa/redir.aspx?C=P2E9KLHRtEKDzYJETFOPyq9t767eHdJI2mypgIzHopccZ08WQbAxJGroQPA3klNqIp82DXgomwc.&URL=http%3a%2f%2fwww.corpus.cam.ac.uk%2fnews%2fprofessor-oliver-rackham-1939-2015%2f%3futm_source%3ddlvr.it%26utm_medium%3dtwitter><br><br>No doubt he is a hugely important figure for many of us...what bad news. I<br>am sure there is a long obituary somewhere expanding on his many invaluable<br>works on the history of British woodlands! [...] Amy Cutler 2014-06-17T17:55:18+01:00 2014-06-17T17:55:18+01:00 Re: planning for Hearts of Oak: Competing Cultures of Woodland https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FOREST-HUMANITIES;7238e612.1406 Dear Rupert and everyone,<br><br>If that's an offer to be part of the organisation/ overseeing, Rupert, I'd<br>be very keen to work together with someone / some people on this,<br>definitely! I've only run smaller conferences previously.<br><br>General update (apologies to those not following, but just in case of<br>interest): one of the major questions at the moment is between applying for<br>the CCIE small grant fund (\ufffd\ufffd500, rolling deadline) or the CCIE Ignite<br>funding (up to \ufffd\ufffd2000; application deadline in September) - details on both<br>are here <http://www.cciexchange.leeds.ac.uk/academics/>. The former would<br>allow us to do a smaller, fairly nimble [...] Rupert Hildyard 2014-06-17T14:20:08+00:00 2014-06-17T14:20:08+00:00 Re: planning for Hearts of Oak: Competing Cultures of Woodland https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FOREST-HUMANITIES;b94ef0eb.1406 Apologies \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd I wasn\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt intending to show off to the whole list\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd(just Amy)<br><br>From: Announcement list for forest research [mailto:FOREST-HUMANITIES@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Rupert Hildyard<br>Sent: 17 June 2014 14:34<br>To: FOREST-HUMANITIES@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: planning for Hearts of Oak: Competing Cultures of Woodland<br><br>Hello Amy,<br>Are you going ahead with this? I am definitely interested\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd re the work of Oliver Rackham in particular.<br>I also have quite a lot of experience of conference organization here at Lincoln (one x ASLE UK conf, 3 x biennial 21st c literature conferences \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd all 4 days, 100+ delegates) if that is useful.<br>Rupert [...] Rupert Hildyard 2014-06-17T13:34:04+00:00 2014-06-17T13:34:04+00:00 Re: planning for Hearts of Oak: Competing Cultures of Woodland https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FOREST-HUMANITIES;7832988a.1406 Hello Amy,<br>Are you going ahead with this? I am definitely interested\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd re the work of Oliver Rackham in particular.<br>I also have quite a lot of experience of conference organization here at Lincoln (one x ASLE UK conf, 3 x biennial 21st c literature conferences \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd all 4 days, 100+ delegates) if that is useful.<br>Rupert Hildyard<br>Principal Lecturer in English, University of Lincoln<br>From: Announcement list for forest research [mailto:FOREST-HUMANITIES@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Amy Cutler<br>Sent: 08 May 2014 14:32<br>To: FOREST-HUMANITIES@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: planning for Hearts of Oak: Competing Cultures of Woodland [...] Amy Cutler 2014-05-19T20:10:15+01:00 2014-05-19T20:10:15+01:00 forest seminar tomorrow https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FOREST-HUMANITIES;1bddb286.1405 Dear all,<br><br>On the off-chance anyone is in the area, I'll be giving the Twentieth<br>Century and Contemporary Literature seminar tomorrow in Cambridge at the<br>English Faculty - on the topic of forests! It starts at 4.30pm (in the<br>Faculty Board Room) and I'm told will go on to drinks and dinner in the<br>usual way. I'll mainly be looking at modern literature which engages with<br>the problem of language and definition related to forests.... [...] tete tetete 2014-05-11T14:55:03+01:00 2014-05-11T14:55:03+01:00 Link for booking a ticket for Screening the Forest https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FOREST-HUMANITIES;22563dd2.1405 Dear all, Regarding Screening the Forest, a screening event at the Horse Hospital on May 21st. Due to the limited space at the Horse Hospital, we decided to create a booking system. In order to join the event, we kindly ask you to make a reservation at our eventbrite link http://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/screening-the-forest-tickets-11569922951 For more information, please go to www.screeningnature.com We apologize for creating any inconveniences and confusion. Thank you very much. Warmest Jennifer Clarke 2014-05-11T09:16:54+09:00 2014-05-11T09:16:54+09:00 Re: planning for Hearts of Oak: Competing Cultures of Woodland https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FOREST-HUMANITIES;a000adc5.1405 Hi Amy<br>I passed this on just last week to Jo Vergunst - my Aberdeen colleague and very recently previously supervisor - who's also working with Tim and Reiko. But I'll let him get in touch.<br>I'll be on fieldwork oct 2014- sep 2015 ish, in Canada and Japan (actually in Tokyo just now but only for a month this time) otherwise I'd be very keen to be involved. [...] Amy Cutler 2014-05-10T20:57:20+01:00 2014-05-10T20:57:20+01:00 Re: planning for Hearts of Oak: Competing Cultures of Woodland https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FOREST-HUMANITIES;99f2d34a.1405 Dear Deirdre and Timothy (and also Camilla and Julian who wrote<br>back-channel),<br><br>Just a very quick message to say that I won't reply properly yet, as I'm on<br>my way to a conference, but this is great to hear. I'll begin shaking some<br>apple trees my end then (pun definitely intended); there's potential with a<br>couple of bodies in Leeds - the Leeds Humanities Research Institute and the<br>Cultural and Creative Industries Exchange - both of which have funding pots<br>for projects crossing between academic research and wider arts / politics /<br>culture. [...] Timothy Collins 2014-05-10T19:43:32+01:00 2014-05-10T19:43:32+01:00 Re: planning for Hearts of Oak: Competing Cultures of Woodland https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FOREST-HUMANITIES;9fc0c4ef.1405 Very interested, if its appropriate I would be happy to think about an<br>interdisciplinary panel that compares the idea of the Centennial Woods, to<br>Specific Caledonian remnant forests as the embodiment post-Culloden<br>conflict here in Scotland.<br><br>There are also questions about contemporary conservation policy and its<br>repetition of the historic pattern of social/cultural exclusion in these<br>forests. This would/could touch on the NEA and the most recent work on<br>social and cultural ecosystem services. [...] Deirdre Heddon 2014-05-10T19:14:09+01:00 2014-05-10T19:14:09+01:00 Re: planning for Hearts of Oak: Competing Cultures of Woodland https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FOREST-HUMANITIES;b5708992.1405 Dear Amy<br><br>I am certainly interested in contributing to this conference and think it's a great idea. Unfortunately, due to the heavy demands of my management role, I am not in a position to help organise it (though of course happy to chair panels etc.)<br><br>Very best wishes and congrats on your appointment at Leeds. [...] Amy Cutler 2014-05-08T14:32:16+01:00 2014-05-08T14:32:16+01:00 planning for Hearts of Oak: Competing Cultures of Woodland https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FOREST-HUMANITIES;303fdc2.1405 Dear all on Forest Humanities,<br><br>I'm in the beginning stages of planning a conference which - the aim is -<br>will take place at the end of this year or early next year, to tie in with<br>the centenary woods project beginning in 2014 and the four new woods being<br>planted in Britain (from this autumn onwards). Before I send around a CFP<br>or more personal invites, I wanted to quickly drop a line to you as a group<br>to see if anyone might be interested in co-organising/ confirming interest<br>at this stage. Also, if there is anything in particular [...] Amy Cutler 2014-04-22T17:58:38+01:00 2014-04-22T17:58:38+01:00 planning for Hearts of Oak: Trees, Culture, and British Identity https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FOREST-HUMANITIES;874a7190.1404 Dear all on Forest Humanities,<br><br>I'm in the beginning stages of planning a conference which - the aim is -<br>will take place at the end of this year or early next year, to tie in with<br>the centenary woods project beginning in 2014 and the four new woods being<br>planted in Britain (from this autumn onwards). Before I send around a CFP<br>or more personal invites, I wanted to quickly drop a line to you as a group<br>to see if anyone might be interested in co-organising/ confirming interest<br>at this stage. Also, if there is anything in particular [...]
